overview: From 2025-07-02 to 2025-07-03, elizaos/eliza had 8 new PRs (6 merged), 0 new issues, and 5 active contributors.

topIssues.title: fix: ensure `bun run test` works consistently across all packages
topIssues.author: wtfsayo
topIssues.body:
## Problem

Currently, `bun run test` does not work consistently across all packages in the ElizaOS monorepo. This creates several issues:

1. **Inconsistent Developer Experience**: Developers cannot reliably run tests in individual packages
2. **CI/CD Fragility**: The root `bun test` command fails, making it difficult to validate changes
3. **Low Test Coverage**: Only 28% of source files have tests (excluding dist files)
4. **Missing Test Infrastructure**: 29% of packages have no test scripts defined

### Current State Analysis

**Test Coverage by Package:**
- ‚úÖ **10/14 packages (71%)** have test scripts defined
- ‚ùå **4/14 packages (29%)** have no test infrastructure
- üî¥ Root `bun test` fails due to `@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap` mock initialization errors

**Packages with Issues:**
1. **No Tests At All:**
   - `@elizaos/app` - Tauri application
   - `@elizaos/autodoc` - Documentation generator
   - `create-eliza` - Scaffolding tool
   - `@elizaos/docs` - Docusaurus site (expected)

2. **Failing Tests:**
   - `@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap` - Mock initialization errors
   - `@elizaos/project-tee-starter` - Environment setup issues

3. **Excluded from Root Tests:**
   - `@elizaos/plugin-starter` (template)
   - `@elizaos/docs` (documentation)
   - `@elizaos/plugin-sql` (has tests but excluded)

## Proposed Solution

Implement a phased approach to ensure all packages have working tests:

### Phase 1: Fix Failing Tests (Priority: High)
- [ ] Fix `@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap` mock initialization errors
- [ ] Fix `@elizaos/project-tee-starter` environment setup issues
- [ ] Ensure root `bun test` command passes

### Phase 2: Add Missing Test Infrastructure (Priority: High)
- [ ] Add test setup to `@elizaos/app` (Tauri app testing)
- [ ] Add test setup to `@elizaos/autodoc`
- [ ] Add test setup to `create-eliza`
- [ ] Create minimal test files to validate setup

### Phase 3: Standardize Test Configuration (Priority: Medium)
- [ ] Create shared test configuration for consistency
- [ ] Standardize coverage reporting (exclude dist/, build/, node_modules/)
- [ ] Add coverage thresholds per package
- [ ] Ensure all packages use Bun test runner consistently

### Phase 4: Documentation & CI Updates (Priority: Medium)
- [ ] Update contributing guide with testing requirements
- [ ] Add pre-commit hooks for test validation
- [ ] Update CI workflows to run package-specific tests
- [ ] Create testing best practices documentation

## Implementation Details

### 1. Shared Test Configuration
Create a base test configuration that all packages can extend:

```typescript
// packages/test-config/base.config.ts
export default {
  testMatch: ["**/*.test.ts", "**/*.spec.ts"],
  coverage: {
    exclude: [
      "**/dist/**",
      "**/build/**",
      "**/node_modules/**",
      "**/*.d.ts",
      "**/coverage/**"
    ],
    threshold: {
      statements: 60,
      branches: 60,
      functions: 60,
      lines: 60
    }
  }
}
```

### 2. Package Test Script Standardization
Ensure every package.json has:
```json
{
  "scripts": {
    "test": "bun test",
    "test:coverage": "bun test --coverage"
  }
}
```

### 3. Fix Root Test Command
Update root package.json to handle package-specific test requirements:
```json
{
  "scripts": {
    "test": "turbo run test --filter=\!@elizaos/docs --filter=\!@elizaos/plugin-starter"
  }
}
```

## Success Criteria

- [ ] `bun run test` works in every package directory
- [ ] Root `bun test` command passes without errors
- [ ] All packages have at least minimal test coverage
- [ ] Test coverage reporting excludes dist/build artifacts
- [ ] CI/CD pipeline runs all tests successfully
- [ ] Developer documentation updated with testing guidelines

## Benefits

1. **Improved Developer Experience**: Consistent testing commands across all packages
2. **Better Code Quality**: Increased test coverage from 28% to target 60%+
3. **Reliable CI/CD**: All PRs validated with comprehensive test suite
4. **Easier Onboarding**: New contributors can confidently run tests
5. **Reduced Bugs**: Catch issues early with standardized testing

## Alternatives Considered

1. **Using Different Test Runners**: Considered Jest/Vitest but Bun test is already established
2. **Monorepo-level Testing Only**: Would miss package-specific issues
3. **Excluding Packages from Testing**: Would leave gaps in coverage

## Additional Context

- Current test coverage is ~28% (excluding dist files)
- The monorepo uses Turbo for orchestration
- Bun test runner is the standard across the project
- Some packages have E2E tests (client) that need special handling

This improvement will significantly enhance the development workflow and code quality across the ElizaOS project.

topPRs.title: chore: improve logs
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added visual spinner animations to indicate progress during migrations.
  * Introduced real-time tracking and display of token usage and estimated costs.
  * Enhanced progress updates with timestamps, emojis, and clearer formatting.
  * Improved tool usage reporting with simplified names, emojis, and elapsed time indicators.

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Improved error and abort handling with detailed messages, recovery suggestions, and better feedback on failures.

* **Chores**
  * Enhanced migration summaries to include detailed statistics on tokens, costs, and operation counts.

topPRs.title: feat: update agent settings UI to match design specifications
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

- Updated dark theme colors for better contrast and visual consistency
- Fixed form field styling with proper border radius (4px) and increased spacing
- Restructured form element order to follow design pattern: label ‚Üí input ‚Üí description
- Increased input height to 48px with proper padding for improved UX
- Removed Card wrapper component for a cleaner, flatter design
- Added consistent spacing between form sections
- Updated typography with lighter label colors and proper font weights

## Changes

- Modified dark theme CSS variables in 
- Updated Input, Textarea, and Select components with consistent styling
- Refactored CharacterForm component to properly structure form fields
- Adjusted Label component with muted foreground color
- Fixed spacing and layout issues throughout the form

## Screenshots

The form now matches the Figma design specifications with proper spacing, colors, and visual hierarchy.

topPRs.title: feat: redesign Agent Cards Homepage Layout
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## üé® UI Redesign: Agent Cards Homepage

This PR redesigns the agent cards on the client homepage to match the target design specification.

### üìã Changes Made

#### **AgentCard Component**
- ‚úÖ **Layout**: Changed from square/vertical to horizontal rectangular cards
- ‚úÖ **Avatar**: Moved to left side, square shape with rounded corners (12x12)
- ‚úÖ **Status Indicator**: Added colored dot (green/red) next to agent name
- ‚úÖ **Description**: Bio text now spans up to 2 lines with proper line clamping
- ‚úÖ **Menu**: Replaced action buttons with three-dot dropdown in top-right corner
- ‚úÖ **Dropdown Options**: 'New Chat', 'Pause/Start Agent', 'Settings'

#### **AddAgentCard Component**
- ‚úÖ **Matching Layout**: Updated to horizontal design matching agent cards
- ‚úÖ **Consistent Spacing**: Same height and padding as agent cards
- ‚úÖ **Square Avatar Area**: Dashed border placeholder with rounded corners

#### **Home Page Layout**
- ‚úÖ **Grid Optimization**: 2 columns on medium+ screens for better display
- ‚úÖ **Spacing**: Reduced gaps for tighter, cleaner layout

### üîß Technical Details

- **Preserved Functionality**: All existing features maintained (start/stop, navigation, error handling)
- **TypeScript Safety**: No type errors, full build compatibility
- **Responsive Design**: Works across all screen sizes
- **Accessibility**: Proper ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, screen reader support
- **Performance**: No performance regressions, efficient rendering

### üéØ Design Alignment

The updated cards now perfectly match the target design with:
- Compact horizontal layout
- Square avatars with rounded corners
- Status indicators with colored dots
- Two-line description support
- Top-right positioned dropdown menus
- Consistent spacing and typography

### üß™ Testing

- ‚úÖ Build passes without errors
- ‚úÖ TypeScript compilation successful
- ‚úÖ All existing functionality preserved
- ‚úÖ Responsive design tested
- ‚úÖ Component structure maintains compatibility

### üì± Before/After

**Before**: Square cards with large avatars, action buttons at bottom
**After**: Horizontal cards with left avatars, status dots, top-right menus

This redesign provides a more modern, space-efficient interface that better showcases agent information while maintaining full functionality.

topPRs.title: fix(client): resolve all type issues in home.tsx for complete type safety
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR fixes all TypeScript type issues in the home.tsx file to ensure complete type safety.

## Changes

- Use  enum instead of string literals for status comparison
- Add proper type imports for  and 
- Add explicit type annotations for  and  hooks
- Fix  to accept  parameter
- Add  to  memoized component
- Properly type  group prop with type assertion
- Ensure all map functions have explicit type annotations

## Testing

- All TypeScript errors have been resolved
- No functionality changes, only type safety improvements
- Verified with  tool - no errors or warnings

## Related Issues

Improves type safety as part of ongoing client improvements.

completedItems.title: fix: update eliza avatar
completedItems.body:
Currently, we are using a large image for the default Eliza avatar, which makes the app load slowly. Since we only need a reasonable resolution for avatars, this PR:

Resizes the default Eliza avatar to 512x512, which is sufficient for UI
